description: Lake Maxwell is located in a cirque above timberline in the Eagle Cap Wilderness of North-eastern Oregon.  The hike starts at Shady Campground and climbs steeply up the east-facing slope.  The trail switches back five or six times before heading up into the hanging valley at about timberline.  We hiked in and out in about 8 hours with our nine-year-old daughter.  Great trail and a beautiful lake. There is GPS data attached to this trail (see "download GPS"), which if loaded into your GPS can help you find route points.
directions: From La Grande, Oregon, take highway 82 to the town of Lostine.  In Lostine, highway 82 takes a right angle bend to the east.  At this corner you want to continue south onto the Lostine River Road.  Shady Campground is about 17.5 miles from the town of Lostine.
title: Lake Maxwell (Oregon)
